channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ukraine Pinning War Hopes on Expanded Drone Program
item.description: With uncertainty looming over cease-fire talks and U.S. support, the Ukrainian military is relying more than ever on domestically produced drones.

item.title: Kurdish Distrust of Syria’s New Government Runs Deep
item.description: The Kurdish-led force that runs northeast Syria has agreed to integrate into a new national army, but some of its supporters remain wary.

item.title: American Children Sent to Honduras, and A.I. on the Battlefield
item.description: Plus, teaching student athletes how to go viral.

item.title: Hybrid COOs are quietly taking over the C-suite
item.description: The hybrid COO is emerging as the glue connecting strategy to execution.

item.title: Decoding the Vatican: Key Terms in the Papal Transition
item.description: From conclave to “camerlengo,” here’s what to know about the words and phrases that guide the process after a pope dies.

item.title: The Trump era has been a bust for private equity—that’s one reason PE is turning to retail
item.description: With private market products, retail may finally get to invest in unicorns.

item.title: Global stocks shake off reports of collapse in U.S. import trade
item.description: Apollo published a slide deck arguing that the reduction in imports would be enough to trigger a recession in the U.S. starting in the summer.

item.title: How legendary venture firm Insight Partners hires—and trains—its next generation of investors to expand its $90 billion warchest
item.description: Landing a spot in Insight’s coveted summer analyst class is more competitive than Harvard.

item.title: Russia’s Putin Thanks Kim for North Korean Troops Fighting in Kursk
item.description: North Korea’s leader, Kim Jong-un, ordered a monument for the “heroic” soldiers killed in Russia’s war against Ukraine, as Moscow and Pyongyang make f...

item.title: Police arrest suspect in theft of Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem’s purse
item.description: Noem's purse was nabbed on Easter Sunday and reportedly contained about $3,000 in cash, her keys, driver’s license, passport and Homeland Security bad...

item.title: What’s at Stake in Canada’s Elections? The Key Issues for Voters
item.description: Many Canadians believe Monday’s election is the most important of their lifetime. It will determine who will take on a stagnant economy and deal with ...

item.title: Rubio Says Trump Will Decide This Week on Continuing Ukraine War Talks
